Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 54151: Computer Systems Design and Related Services
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: The Department of Justice announced that 3M Company agreed to pay $9.1 million to resolve allegations that it knowingly sold the dual-ended Combat Arms Earplugs, Version 2 (CAEv2) to the United States military without disclosing defects that hampered the effectiveness of the hearing protection device.

Description: Saint-Gobain Performance Plastics, Honeywell International and 3M agreed to pay a total of $65.25 million to settle litigation alleging they were responsible for contamination of the water supply of Hoosick Falls, New York with firefighting foam containing perfluorooctanoic acid (PFOA), also known as a forever chemical. The parties did not disclose how much each company would pay. Here we assume the total was divided evenly among them.
Private Litigation Case Title: Baker et al v. Saint-Gobain Performance Plastics Corp. et al
Info Source: https://www.law360.com/articles/1462104/-65m-new-york-forever-chemical-water-suit-gets-final-ok
https://ww2.arb.ca.gov/3m-company-settlement-2021

Description: Hazardous Waste - 3M failed to properly store hazardous waste containers in permitted hazardous waste storage areas. The investigation found one container of hydrofluoric acid releasing toxic gas into the air. An additional 901 hazardous waste containers containing hydrofluoric acid, some with bulging barrel lids, were stored throughout the Cottage Grove facility. 3M failed to immediately notify the MPCA of an excessive and abnormal unpermitted emission that may cause air pollution that endangers human health.
Info Source: https://www.pca.state.mn.us/sites/default/files/gp2-2021.pdf

Description: payment for work during meal breaks
Private Litigation Case Title: Jason Holloway v. 3M Company, et al
Info Source: https://www.law360.com/articles/1363255/3m-workers-get-initial-ok-for-1-5m-settlement-in-wage-case

Description: 3M Company and Georgia-Pacific agreed to pay $11.9 million to settle a class action lawsuit alleging that polyfluoroalkyl substances (PFAS) from a former paper mill contaminated water supplies in Parchment, Michigan. The settlement did not specify how much each would pay. Here we assume the total was divided equally between them.
Private Litigation Case Title: Dykehouse et al v. The 3M Company et al
Info Source: https://www.mlive.com/news/kalamazoo/2021/04/119m-settlement-reached-in-lawsuit-after-parchment-drinking-water-found-with-dangerous-pfas-levels.html

Description: 3M agreed to pay $12.5 million to the city of Bemidji, Minnesota to resolve allegations that damgerous chemicals known as PFAS iontained n fire-fighting foam produced by the company contaminated the city's water supply.
Info Source: https://www.mprnews.org/story/2021/04/04/bemidji-settles-with-3m-over-water-treatment-for-forever-chemicals
http://adem.alabama.gov/compInfo/2021orders.pdf
